intro: Ischaemum kotschyi, commonly known as the desert grass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that bear both male and female flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Ischaemum kotschyi plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for livestock in its native habitats.
